info.title: One Skillet 'Egg Roll in a Bowl'
info.description: Embark on a flavour-packed journey with this Egg Roll in a Bowl recipe – a deconstructed twist on the classic Asian favourite that brings all the savoury goodness without the fuss of rolling and frying. Packed with a colourful medley of crisp vegetables, savoury ground turkey, and a symphony of aromatic spices, this dish is a celebration of bold flavours and wholesome ingredients.

items.name: Ground turkey breast
items.qualifierString: substitute with ground chicken, ground beef, or ground pork

directions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ground meat and cook, stirring, until no longer pink. Drain; return meat to skillet.
Add diced onion, sesame oil, and rice vinegar to the skillet. Cook, stirring, for a few more minutes (until onion is tender).
Add garlic, ginger, soy sauce, hoisin sauce (optional), coleslaw mix, and carrots to the skillet. Cook, stirring, for about 5-7 more minutes, or until cabbage is wilted.
Remove skillet from the heat. Stir in green onions and season with salt and pepper, to taste.

structuredData.name: One Skillet 'Egg Roll in a Bowl'
structuredData.description: All of the delicious flavors of your favorite fried Chinese restaurant appetizer come together in a lighter, faster, one skillet meal! This 'Egg Roll in a Bowl' is a quick and healthy dinner that's ready in about 20 minutes!
recipeIngredient: 1 pound Ground turkey breast (substitute with ground chicken, ground beef, or ground pork)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ground meat and cook, stirring, until no longer pink. Drain; return meat to skillet.
Add diced onion, sesame oil, and rice vinegar to the skillet. Cook, stirring, for a few more minutes (until onion is tender).
Add garlic, ginger, soy sauce, hoisin sauce (optional), coleslaw mix, and carrots to the skillet. Cook, stirring, for about 5-7 more minutes, or until cabbage is wilted.
Remove skillet from the heat. Stir in green onions and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
